    • Method Detail

      • generate4Operator

        public static SwimRequestBean generate4Operator(DAO sql,
                                                SwimRequestBean swimReqBean,
                                                java.lang.String operator)
                                         throws BackendException
        The method generates the request for the executor. The given request is a FORMAL request used as parent of the request to generate for the executor.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        swimReqBean - FORMAL request used as parent of the request to generate for the executor
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateRequest(DAO sql,
                                              SwimRequestBean swimReqBean,
                                              java.lang.String permission,
                                              java.lang.String operator)
                                       throws BackendException
        The method generates a request. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Depending by the permission given, some fields of the request are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a user access change (or admin user access change) process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. If the permission belongs to a delegation access change (or admin delegation access change) process: applicant, beneficiary and delegant codes are mandatory. In these two cases, it should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of roles (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean. If the permission belongs to an account change process: applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. In this case it should also be provided at least one or more of three possible lists of accounts (to lock, to unlock or to reset). It is important to know that the name field must be valorized and, in case of account lock, it is mandatory also to valorize the block field to configurate correctly the account. If the permission belongs to an entity change process: applicant code is mandatory.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        swimReqBean - request to generate, applicant code is always mandatory, beneficiary code is generally mandatory
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateAccessChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateAccessChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                          java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                          java.lang.String beneficiaryCode,
                                                          java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> rolesToAdd,
                                                          java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> rolesToRemove,
                                                          java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> rolesToChange,
                                                          java.lang.String permission,
                                                          java.lang.String operator)
                                                   throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of access change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Each of the given roles must be identified uniquely. Applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. It should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of roles (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        beneficiaryCode - beneficiary user code, mandatory
        rolesToAdd - list of roles to add to the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        rolesToRemove - list of roles to remove from the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        rolesToChange - list of roles of the beneficiary to change, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateAdminAccessChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateAdminAccessChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                               java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                               java.lang.String beneficiaryCode,
                                                               java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminRolesToAdd,
                                                               java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminRolesToRemove,
                                                               java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminRolesToChange,
                                                               java.lang.String permission,
                                                               java.lang.String operator)
                                                        throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of admin access change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Each of the given admin roles must be identified uniquely. Applicant and beneficiary codes are mandatory. It should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of roles (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        beneficiaryCode - beneficiary user code, mandatory
        adminRolesToAdd - list of admin roles to add to the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        adminRolesToRemove - list of admin roles to remove from the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        adminRolesToChange - list of admin roles of the beneficiary to change, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateDelegationChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateDelegationChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                              java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                              java.lang.String beneficiaryCode,
                                                              java.lang.String delegantCode,
                                                              java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> delegationsToAdd,
                                                              java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> delegationsToRemove,
                                                              java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> delegationsToChange,
                                                              java.lang.String permission,
                                                              java.lang.String operator)
                                                       throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of delegation change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Each of the given roles must be identified uniquely. Applicant, beneficiary and delegant codes are mandatory. It should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of delegations (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        beneficiaryCode - beneficiary user code, mandatory
        delegantCode - delegant user code, mandatory
        delegationsToAdd - list of delegations to add to the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        delegationsToRemove - list of delegations to remove from the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        delegationsToChange - list of delegations of the beneficiary to change, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateAdminDelegationChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateAdminDelegationChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                                   java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                                   java.lang.String beneficiaryCode,
                                                                   java.lang.String delegantCode,
                                                                   java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminDelegationsToAdd,
                                                                   java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminDelegationsToRemove,
                                                                   java.util.List<SwimEntitlementBean> adminDelegationsToChange,
                                                                   java.lang.String permission,
                                                                   java.lang.String operator)
                                                            throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of admin delegation change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Each of the given admin roles must be identified uniquely. Applicant, beneficiary and delegant codes are mandatory. It should also be provided at least one or more of the three possible lists of delegations (to add, to remove or to change). It is important to know that the roles to add could have some rights to valorize, in this case these rights have to be valorized and put into the corresponding roles before to associate them to the request bean.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        beneficiaryCode - beneficiary user code, mandatory
        delegantCode - delegant user code, mandatory
        adminDelegationsToAdd - list of admin role delegations to add to the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        adminDelegationsToRemove - list of admin role delegations to remove from the beneficiary, each defined uniquely
        adminDelegationsToChange - list of admin role delegations of the beneficiary to change, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateAccountChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateAccountChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                           java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                           java.lang.String beneficiaryCode,
                                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Block> accountsToLock,
                                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> accountsToUnLock,
                                                           java.util.List<java.lang.String> accountsToReset,
                                                           java.lang.String permission,
                                                           java.lang.String operator)
                                                    throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of account change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. Each of the accounts must be identified uniquely by the given names. The parameter accountsToLock is a map with the account names as keyset and their block codes as valueset.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        beneficiaryCode - beneficiary user code, mandatory
        accountsToLock - list of names of accounts to lock, each defined uniquely
        accountsToUnLock - list of names of accounts to unlock, each defined uniquely
        accountsToReset - list of names of accounts to reset, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

        accountsToLock - list of names of accounts to lock, each defined uniquely
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException

      • generateEntityChangeRequest

        public static SwimRequestBean generateEntityChangeRequest(DAO sql,
                                                          java.lang.String applicantCode,
                                                          java.util.List<EntityScopeFieldBean> entityScopeFields,
                                                          java.lang.String permission,
                                                          java.lang.String operator)
                                                   throws BackendException
        The method generates a request of entity change. The permission string identifies the process and the activity to which the request belongs. The entity scope fields depends by the configuration of the activity to which the request belongs.
        Parameters:
        sql - mandatory connection parameter
        applicantCode - applicant user code, mandatory
        entityScopeFields - fields of the entity to insert, update or delete
        permission - permission used to associate the request to a process and activity. Mandatory and consistently composed. The permission is composed by: activity mode + "/" + activity name + "$" + process name
        operator - operator code, if NULL then it is used "RuleAction"
        Returns:
        informal request generated
        Throws:
        BackendException
